We are ‚Äúalone‚Äù ‚Ä¶ for all practical purposes. As horrible and lonely and depressing as that may sound, humans may be the most advanced, the most intelligent species in the galaxy. Many more scientists smarter than me are starting to come to this conclusion. For many years I chose to believe in the thread that if Earth is teeming with life, other similar planets must also.  The issue is with the billions of variables that went into the rise of human beings. If we rewound the clock and started Earth over, there is only about a 1 in 500 billion chance we‚Äôd end up again with human beings.  The galaxy and universe for that matter, is an extremely violent and harsh place to survive. So there may be a Milky Way out there teeming with all sorts of life‚Ä¶ bacteria, fish, frogs, lizards, and dinosaurs‚Ä¶but forget about little green men. If they are out there, the distances and other obstacles in the way of them coming HERE are so astronomical‚Ä¶times a billion‚Ä¶that we are alone for all practical purposes.

Language from today's NY Post article: "Earlier this year, officials confirmed they had investigated 144 UFO sightings reported by government sources since 2004, including unexplained vehicles that traveled at speeds of up to 43,000 miles per hour and changed direction on a dime."

An ex-military person on his YouTube channel made an observation that is hard to ignore. Who operates inside restricted airspace? Our military. So who is operating these advanced unidentified objects?

There are three possibilities. Aliens are here monitoring our military. Or US adversaries are monitoring our military with their top secret advanced equipment. Or these are US black project craft operating in restricted airspace, exactly where they should be doing their testing.

What seems more likely? If you study the subject you know about Bob Lazar. He described a craft back in the '80s that was recorded in a Navy video called the "gimble UFO" about 20 years later. It gives his story a lot of credibility. According to him we've been working to back-engineer recovered advanced technology of unknown origin. It very well may be that we've had some success.

In the 2004 Nimitz encounter an object described as a Tic-Tac flew close to a military jet and zipped away. It showed up at a point in the sky many miles away that turned out to be where that same jet was to go before returning to the carrier. Who would do that? Aliens? Or maybe other service members playing mind games with the Navy pilot. You decide, but I tend to believe it was the latter.
